parameters.definition: Input resources required for each option in each process
Output produced for each price point in each process

description: We want to know how many times should we execute each process to maximize the revenue for the next month (you can assume that the number of times that each process is executed is a floating point number). The problem involves \param{O} options, \param{P} price points, and \param{L} processes with \param{Allocated} resources, \param{Price} at each price point, \param{Input} required for each option in each process, \param{Output} produced for each price point in each process, and \param{Cost} for each process.
